page.title: 14Village Life in New Mill.
page.content: In an age of rapid changes traditional village life still survives.New Mill is a typical example of this.Many of the community still work in the local textile industry.Along side the mills other villagers find employment with the local shops, pubs and garages.These villages are continually growing.They do not support the whole work force.Many people commute daily into Huddersfield for their work, but are content to seek the peace of their homes in this quiet village.At a time of decaying urban areas property in these outlying villages is greatly prized.It is not just the bright lights of town where you can find amusement.Village life is a full life for those who want it to be.There are activities for old and young.The church,clubs and pubs provide sporting and social activities.
